title: Instructional Design Based on Mixed Research Methods for E-Learning Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics education theories and classroom teaching experience
context.additional_context: Corporate teacher competency enhancement program exploring e-learning integration strategies based on offline classes in limited-technology environments (smartphone-centric)

learning_goals: Learners can design a research plan analyzing e-learning PD effectiveness using mixed research methods (quantitative/qualitative).
Learners can explain three or more ways organizational structures and individual factors influence e-learning PD participation.
Learners can collect and evaluate peer teachers' informal learning cases using smartphone-based tools (e.g., Google Forms, KakaoTalk surveys).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
